Title: Key Learning Points: BASHH Anogenital Warts
Teaser: Dr Amy Cleese reviews the diagnosis and management of anogenital warts in general practice, offering six key learning points from updated guidance

Title: Alternate Insomnia Therapy Has Good Showing
Teaser: The brief nurse-delivered therapy aimed at restricting and standardising time in bed could make treatment more accessible to primary care patients.

Title: Recurrent UTI: Undercultured, Overtreated Despite Resistance
Teaser: Roughly 40% of general practitioners do not culture recurrent UTIs and instead, just treat.

Title: High-Dose Psilocybin Shows Promising Results for Depression
Teaser: A meta-analysis found that high-dose psilocybin for depressive symptoms showed better responses than placebo or escitalopram in antidepressant trials.

Title: Female Doctors' Suicide Rates Alarmingly Higher vs General Folks
Teaser: Male physicians have a similar suicide rate to the general public, but female physicians show a notably higher suicide rate.

Title: Men, Women, & Exercise: Metabolism Differs at Starting Line
Teaser: The muscles of sedentary men and women with overweight and obesity differ in burning sugar and fatty acids at the start of an exercise program but draw even after training, multi-omics data show.

Title: Kidney Donor Mortality Plummets Over 30 Years
Teaser: The risk for perioperative mortality in living kidney donors has significantly reduced in the past decade, a study showed.

Title: Continuous Glucose Monitor Benefits All Ages With Diabetes
Teaser: Intermittently scanned continuous glucose monitoring improved glycaemic outcomes in those older and younger than 65 years, but the older group may need individualised targets.

Title: Hot Flashes, Night Sweats Linked to Menopausal Heart Disease
Teaser: Early onset and long duration were associated with particularly high risk.

Title: Key Learning Points: Early Breast Cancer
Teaser: Dr Fharat Raja highlights 10 key learning points in the updated ESMO guideline on early breast cancer
